title: Data Scientist - Group Enterprise
description: I built a proposal generator GenAI tool to streamline the bid & tender process for Singtel Enterprise's sales team. I also built core features for a SQL-enabled chatbot app to facilitate information retrieval for the service management team.

detailDescription: I was tasked with developing a MVP for a web-app to allow our sales team to generate effective proposals from Requests for Proposal (RFP) documents. Furthermore, I was given only 20 weeks to do this. I developed ~80% of the required features within 5 weeks, with the remaining ~20% stalled due to external dependencies.

Proposal generation was accomplished through a multi-step RAG chain. Firstly, the proposal structure is generated based on past similar proposals. Finally, the content for each section is generated based on the RFP, various knowledge vector DBs, and past proposals.

The app is fully integrated with Singtel AD, and users are able to sign in with SSO via their Singtel email accounts. As a side effect, the app is also well integrated with Microsoft Graph API - allowing us to explore additional GenAI features involving users' emails, sharepoint content, etc.

My tech-stack consisted of FastAPI for backend and React for frontend. I used PostGres as my app DB, and also explored Qdrant and FAISS as vector DBs. For GenAI, I used a GPT 3.5 model hosted on Azure OpenAI service (we couldn't use the public GPT 3.5 due to data sensitivity concerns) which I interfaced with using the LangChain framework. The app was designed in an asynchronus manner to better handle concurrency.

I was tasked with developing the backend and chatbot functionality for a chatbot web-app. One of the app's main features lets users ask a GenAI agent questions based on data in Singtel's databases. The agent would then generate the relevant SQL query and execute it, using the results to answer the user's question. This greatly facilitates information retrieval for users, whose current practice involves looking through multiple cumbersome and outdated systems.

SQL generation is a complex task which is further confounded by Singtel's highly complex database schemas. Hence, a significant amount of prompt-engineering and customization was required to develop an accurate SQL-enabled chatbot. The final design involved a complex LLM chain with multiple routes to handle different complex scenarios, as well as a custom SQLAgent with a custom toolkit to better handle general queries on Singtel's databases.
I used FastAPI as the backend with SQLite as the app DB. LangChain was used as the GenAI framework, with a GPT3.5 model hosted on Azure OpenAI service as the underlying LLM.

title: Data Scientist - Group IT
description: I did product analytics to identify improvement opportunities for the MySingtel app and used it to design a POC with better UX. I also drove the R&D of an AI enabled real-time coupon allocator to enhance user experience and conversion rate in the roaming funnel.
tech: Matplotlib, PyTorch, scikit-learn, PuLP, R, FastAPI

detailDescription: I was in charge of analysing customer behavior data on MSTA using FullStory, a data platform which tracks in-app interactions. The main goal was to derive insights to ultimately enhance user experience in the roaming funnel and increase conversion rates.

Using process mining, I modelled user behavior patterns as a Directly-Follows Graph (DFG) and identified the most common user flows within the roaming funnel, which I used to identify the key interactions preceding drop-offs as potential pain points which deterred users from converting. Next, I scraped Singtel's social media pages and app store reviews and conducted topic modelling to identify common themes for customer complaints related to roaming.

With this, I worked with UI designers and software engineers to design an enhanced roaming funnel UI which sought to address the identified pain points. Research findings and the proposed redesign were presented to senior leaders to seek approval for an A/B test to measure the effectiveness.

Inspired by a white-paper by AliBaba researchers, I spearheaded an initiative to develop a POC for an AI-powered real-time coupon allocation system to boost conversion rate on the Singtel app's roaming funnel.

The system works by predicting a user's conversion probability given each available coupon type based on their behavior within the roaming funnel (i.e which buttons they tapped, how long they spend on a screen, etc), and then applying linear programming to determine the optimal coupon allocation strategy which maximises total conversion while minimising total cost. Since the allocation is done in real-time, an online linear-programming strategy had to be used.

For conversion probability prediction, I trained an AI model using customer behavior data retrieved from FullStory. I experimented with various algorithms, including Time-Aware LSTMs, transformer networks, and gradient boosting, to determine the best model. Next, to develop the online linear programming model, I implemented an algorithm introduced in another white-paper which proposed calculating thresholds based on the dual solution of the offline LP problem; these thresholds can then be used to determine the solution for the primal problem in an online manner.
Finally, I architectured a solution to allow the Singtel app to interface with the system and developed a POC using FastAPI and React Native which was presented to senior leaders.

title: Data Science Intern
description: I built a feature for a web-app which allows non-technical users to train a neural network with few-shot learning for effective text classification. I also built a feature for users to quickly search through a text database using fulltext indexes.

company: NUS Institute of Operations Research & Analytics
title: Research Assistant (Data Science)
description: I developed novel methods to process textual data to improve classification accuracy for a listed medical device company (ResMed).

title: Full Stack Developer Intern
description: I developed a Shopify app which uses AI to recommend clothing sizes to customers given their body dimensions. The app also has an admin panel for merchants to fine-tune the recommendation logic.
tech: MongoDB, ExpressJS, React, GraphQL, scikit-learn, R

title: Data Analyst Intern
description: I maintained Tableau dashboards and conducted database migration.
